senses.sense_definition: To roll something or move it on wheels.

examples.text: The workers <w>trindled</w> the heavy barrels across the warehouse floor.
Children <w>trindled</w> their hoops down the cobblestone street.

senses.sense_definition: A wheel, particularly one attached to a wheelbarrow.

examples.text: The gardener fixed the squeaky <w>trindle</w> on his old cart.
Without a functioning <w>trindle</w>, the barrow was impossible to move.

senses.sense_definition: A thin piece of wood or metal placed between the cords and boards of a book to flatten the back before cutting.

examples.text: The binder inserted a <w>trindle</w> to prepare the volume for the cutting press.
You must position the <w>trindle</w> carefully to ensure the book spine remains flat.
